properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 21 at 10:31AM MST until January 21 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...A DISTURBANCE IS BRINGING SNOW TO PARTS OF NORTH CENTRAL AND
WESTERN NM...

.A storm system will cross the state from the west through this
evening with rain and snow. Anomalously high moisture associated
with this system will result in a few to several inches of snow
over the northern and west central mountains, as well as the
northwest highlands with near a foot atop mountain peaks. The snow
level will rise above 7000 feet this afternoon, and then drop
some this evening as the storm exits to the east.

* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to 3
inches.

* WHERE...Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass.

* WHEN...From 7 AM this morning to 6 PM MST this evening.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means
that periods of snow will primarily cause travel difficulties.
Be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING
